story.text: (Adds details) Jan 3 Wachovia Capital Markets downgraded auto supplier Lear Corp. (LEA.N) to "underperform" from "market perform", as its launch tempo begins to weaken on vehicle production volatility of large pickup trucks, SUV's and minivans. The brokerage believes that the re-acceleration of price pressures at Tier 2 and Tier 3 suppliers will mute margin expansion coming from lower launch costs and new product launches. The brokerage downgraded Magna International Inc. (MGA.N) MGa.TO, also an auto supplier, to "market perform" from "outperform", noting that the company's North American SUV, minivan and pickup exposure will continue to press margins in the near-term. Wachovia also downgraded auto retailers Lithia Motors Inc. (LAD.N) and AutoNation Inc. (AN.N) to "market perform" from outperform". Wachovia expects brand mix to continue to hurt AutoNation, and that its recent performance in used vehicles and parts and service has been disappointing relative to the competition. For Lithia Motors, the brokerage said it thinks upside to the stock hinges on meaningful shift in mix back to traditional light trucks, which Wachovia does not see happening in 2007. In addition, Wachovia said other efforts at Lithia such as used vehicle inventory management and consolidation of administrative functions won't have a positive effect on operating margins until 2008. (Reporting by Tenzin Pema in Bangalore)
